Steps.Message:
Sent by Luke at 21:19 - Our engineers have completed their investigations.

There's going to be a lot of work required to repair the issue safely, so we have decided to use temporary generators to provide power. To allow time for us to get the generators out to your area and connect them, we're now estimating we'll have power back on between 03:00 and 04:00.

We're sorry to change the time frame and will let you know when they arrive.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Luke at 20:53 - Thanks for your patience this evening.

Our staff are checking our equipment throughout the area to pinpoint the issue on our overhead cabling network. In addition to this, they are liaising closely with our control room to find safe and reliable ways to divert power around any problems and get everyone restored.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them. We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have arrived on site in the RH19 4 and RH18 5 area to investigate the power cut affecting 92 properties.

Specialist engineers are also working to divert power remotely, and this can cause your lights to go on and off.

We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. Sent by Luke at 20:23.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Luke at 19:36 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 19:28. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

Steps.Message: Good morning, this is a message from Ryan at UK Power Networks regarding the planned power cut that is currently in progress today the 3rd of December 2025 in the CO7 postcode area. It was just to let you know that our customer support vehicle is on site and is located in the car park of the church on Church Road where they will provide free hot drinks, charging points, Wi-Fi and face-to-face support. Please feel free to visit Simon from our welfare team if you require any assistance whilst the power is off. Our reference number for this is INCD-105617-C. If you have any questions or you have moved from the CO7 postcode area, then please call 105.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript:
This work is taking place near Heath Road.

We regularly inspect our electrical equipment to ensure it is safe and efficient. We need to examine
a transformer on our electricity poles to check it is functioning properly. This essential work helps
to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power
cuts in the future as we appreciate some customers may have experienced an unplanned power
cut in the last 6 months.
To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your
electricity. We are taking extra measures to limit the time your power is off and we'll do our best to
cause as little disruption as possible. Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network
in the future.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of our equipment in your area. This has identified cables and 6 poles that need replacing and upgrading. We will also be replacing stay wires and transferring service cables to the new poles. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate your area has been impacted with unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. To complete the work safely, we need to turn your power off to upgrade the equipment. To ensure the power is off for the shortest possible time, our contractors may carry out preparation works prior to the power cut. This work is taking place in Cooks Drove. A road closure will be in place to allow the work to be carried out safely. Access to your property will always be provided.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Will at 04:49 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all but 2 of the 902 affected customers in the Uckfield, TN22 5 and Lewes, BN8 6 area, by diverting power around the overhead network fault. We know your power may have been off for a long time, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have been in touch to advise they have come across a grounded overhead cable that has been brought down by a large tree. They are aiming to make a cut on an overhead cable which will allow them to restore power to the majority of those still affected.

The remaining properties will be restored by our team connecting a temporary generator to one of our sites that are affected. Further assessments are underway at this time for the repairs and equipment needed but as soon as we have an estimated time frame or any more information, I will let you know.

In the meantime, if you have any further questions or concerns, don't hesitate to call us free on 08003163105. Sent by Will at 04:29.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Will at 03:19 - Our staff have made more progress diverting power, so a further 43 homes and businesses now have their lights safely back on. We know there's still 42 properties affected by the power cut, and if your power is still off, don't worry - we'll continue to send you updates from our staff. We may send a few texts like this, so if your power has come back on now, or does at any point later on, just follow this link to stop our SMS updates https://bit.ly/348KOZ3.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We regularly inspect our electrical equipment to ensure it is safe and efficient. We need to examine transformers on our electricity poles to check they are functioning properly. We are aware the area has been impacted by both planned and unplanned power cuts the the last 6 months and this essential work helps to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power cuts in the future. To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your electricity. We are taking extra measures to limit the time your power is off and we'll do our best to cause as little disruption as possible. Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future. This work is taking place in Cliftons Lane.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We were investigating a high voltage overhead electricity line fault which caused a power cut in the local area.

Logs.Comment:
Sent by Will at 22:52 - We can now confirm that power to all but 2 sites in the Hailsham BN27 & Polegate BN26 area should be back on. Our engineers have diverted power around a grounded overheads cable. However, due to the location and complexity of the issue, we have also used a temporary generator to restore power to the last of the affected properties. This will provide power until our engineers plan in and safely complete the full repair, which may take a few days.

We're really sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused. If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

Our engineers have just called in to advise us that the temporary generator is on site, however there seems to be something causing it to trip off. They are working to get this resolved as soon as they can.

Unfortunately, it's going to take us past our current time frame to complete this safely, so we're now working towards between 23:30 and 00:30 to have power back on.

We can appreciate how frustrating and disruptive being without power can be, and our staff are working as fast as they can. If you have any questions or concerns, please feel free to speak to our team, but I'll let you know further news as it comes in from site. Sent by Will at 22:21.

Hi, this is Will - I wanted to let you know I have just taken over for the night shift, so I'll be here until tomorrow morning making sure you have the latest news from our staff.

I know that power being off may be especially worrying for you as we head later into the evening, but our field teams work 24 hours so I'll let know further news as soon as it comes in.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We regularly inspect our electrical equipment to ensure it is safe and efficient. We need to examine a transformer on our electricity poles to check it is functioning properly. This essential work helps to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power cuts in the future. To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your electricity. We are taking extra measures to limit the time your power is off and we'll do our best to cause as little disruption as possible. Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future. This work is taking place in Wells Road.

Sent by Aaron at 19:02 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 338 customers in the Watford WD1/WD17/WD24 area, without the need for a temporary generator, by diverting power around the underground fault. We know your power may have been off for a long time,, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Aaron at 17:55 - We're sorry for the disruption to your power today, we appreciate how disruptive this must be for you, especially for those who may be more vulnerable without the electric. If you're worried about an elderly or ill person in your property who is affected by the power cut today, we are able to provide some support. For more information just click here: https://bit.ly/40quttu If you have any further concerns or questions though, don't hesitate to call us free on 08003163105. We'll continue to keep you updated with our engineer's progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Sent by Aaron at 16:18 - Our engineers have completed their investigations.

We're sorry to change the time frame and will let you know when they arrive.

This work is taking place near Netherfield Lane. The What3words location is dinner.quite.prone.

Sent by Decasta at 11:34 - Thanks for your patience today. Our engineers have now investigated the low hanging overhead cable due to a fallen tree, and have deemed it safe to restore power back to all 744 properties in the Dorking RH5 5 area.

We're very sorry we had to turn your power off unexpectedly, and with so little warning. We usually provide much more notice if we can, but in a situation like this our first priority is the safety of the public and our staff.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. If your power is still off or if you have any questions, call our team on 08003163105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Logs.Comment:
Sent by Kevin at 12:45 - I'm pleased to confirm that all power in the North Cray Road area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected underground network fault, which our engineers repaired.

We know that a power cut can be difficult, and I'm sorry for the length of the time you were without your electricity. Please rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

Sent by Kevin at 11:14 - Our engineers are still working to restore your power.

We're sorry for the disruption this power cut may be causing. If you're worried about elderly or ill neighbours, we can offer help and support to our vulnerable customers during a power cut. Find out more here: https://bit.ly/40quttu.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript:
This work is taking place along Durant Road.

To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of our
equipment in your area. This has identified 4 spans of cables, 11 service cables and 6 poles that
need upgrading. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future
as we appreciate your area has been impacted with unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months.
To complete the work safely, we need to turn your power off to upgrade the equipment. To ensure
the power is off for the shortest possible time, our contractors Avidety may carry out preparation
works prior to the power cut.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 11:15 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 1942 customers in the CM7 4/5 and CO9 area, by removing a tree branch from our overhead network. We understand how difficult a power cut can be, so we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Theo at 10:06 - We're sorry for the disruption to your power today, we appreciate how disruptive this must be for you, especially for those who may be more vulnerable without the electric. If you're worried about an elderly or ill person in your property who is affected by the power cut today, we are able to provide some support. For more information just click here: https://bit.ly/40quttu If you have any further concerns or questions though, don't hesitate to call us free on 08003163105. We'll continue to keep you updated with our engineer's progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 09:57 - Thanks for your patience this morning.

Our staff are checking our equipment throughout the area to pinpoint the issue on our overhead cabling network. In addition to this, they are liaising closely with our control room to find safe and reliable ways to divert power around any problems and get everyone restored.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them. We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript:
This work is taking place near The Street.

To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of trees
near our overhead cables. This has identified trees that have grown close, which could damage
the cables and affect your electricity supply.
Our engineers need to temporarily switch off your power so we can safely cut the trees away from
10 sections of cables. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the
future as we appreciate some customers may have experienced unplanned power cuts in the last
6 months.

Steps.Message: Good afternoon, this is a message from Ryan at UK Power Networks regarding the planned power cut that is currently in progress today the 3rd of December 2025 in the GU5 postcode area. Our engineers have advised that unfortunately there is going to be a delay in restoring your power. This is due to additional preparation works being required for the third party to trim a section of trees away from the overhead cables, so the works are taking a bit longer than originally expected. We now estimate to restore your power between approximately 15:30-16:30. Please note that this is an estimated timeframe so your power may come on sooner. Our reference number for this work is INCD-326897-U. We would like to apologise for any inconvenience this may cause you. If you have any questions or you have moved from the GU5 postcode area, then please call 105.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We regularly inspect our electrical equipment to ensure it is safe and efficient. We need to examine a transformer on our electricity poles to check it is functioning properly. This essential work helps to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power cuts in the future as we appreciate some customers may have experienced unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your electricity. We are taking extra measures to limit the time your power is off and we'll do our best to cause as little disruption as possible. Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future. This work is taking place near Larters Lane.

future.

Sent by Bev at 21:03 - We can now confirm that all power in the Fieldway area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected fault with some of our network equipment, which our engineers have now replaced.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Bev at 20:09 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Decasta at 11:55 - We can now confirm that all power in the area should be back on. Our engineers had to unexpectedly turn off the power to 563 customers in the E13 0/9 area to safely repair damage on the high voltage network.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Decasta at 10:53 - We're sorry for the disruption to your power today, we appreciate how disruptive this must be for you, especially for those who may be more vulnerable without the electric. If you're worried about an elderly or ill person in your property who is affected by the power cut today, we are able to provide some support. For more information just click here: https://bit.ly/40quttu If you have any further concerns or questions though, don't hesitate to call us free on 08003163105. We'll continue to keep you updated with our engineer's progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

Our staff have found a potentially dangerous situation involving a network fault so have responded as quickly as possible and asked our control room to turn power off to the area using our high voltage network. This is why a wide area has lost electricity.

Our field teams are working to fix the issue as quickly as possible, and we'll start diverting power back to affected homes as soon as they advise us it's safe. You may notice your lights going on and off as we work to get as much power restored as we can. Our estimated time frame to restore power is between 12:00-13:00.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information.

Sent by Stuart at 20:16 - I'm texting to say I am glad to report that power to the Kirkton Road area should now be back on.

I'm sorry for the continued disruption recently. We believe there may be a fault on our underground electricity cabling in the area, but currently it has not developed to a stage that our staff can pinpoint it. Their tests have proven inconclusive, so for now they have replaced our safety equipment at the substation to get your power back on as quickly as possible.

This may happen again before we're able to fix it, but if you'd like to talk to us about this, or if your power isn't on call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
I appreciate your continued patience this evening. I know having power cuts as often as this must be very disruptive, and our staff are doing everything they can to get this resolved.

They are still testing our network in the area, and depending on the local infrastructure this can take some time. However, once they update us we'll know if our estimated time frame needs to change and why, and I'll let you know as soon as we hear.

In the meantime, if we can offer any support or advice, our team are always available to talk on 105.

Logs.Comment:
Sent by Stuart at 20:16 - I'm texting to say I am glad to report that power to the Kirkton Road area should now be back on.

I'm sorry for the continued disruption recently. We believe there may be a fault on our underground electricity cabling in the area, but currently it has not developed to a stage that our staff can pinpoint it. Their tests have proven inconclusive, so for now they have replaced our safety equipment at the substation to get your power back on as quickly as possible.

This may happen again before we're able to fix it, but if you'd like to talk to us about this, or if your power isn't on call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

I appreciate your continued patience this evening. I know having power cuts as often as this must be very disruptive, and our staff are doing everything they can to get this resolved.

They are still testing our network in the area, and depending on the local infrastructure this can take some time. However, once they update us we'll know if our estimated time frame needs to change and why, and I'll let you know as soon as we hear.

In the meantime, if we can offer any support or advice, our team are always available to talk on 105.

Sent by Decasta at 13:38 - We can now confirm that all power in the Bristol Gardens W9 2 area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected fault with some of our network equipment, which our engineers have now replaced.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Our engineers have arrived on site in the Bristol Gardens W9 2 area, the estimated time of 16:00-17:00 hasn't changed. We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress, but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. Steps.Message:
Hello, this is Donna from UK Power Networks regarding the planned power cut that is scheduled for today Wednesday 03/12/2025 in the Winch Road area. 

The engineers on site have advised us that there is going to be a delay in the power being switched off due to issues with traffic management. We now estimate to switch off your power by approximately 10:00.

We would like to apologise for any inconvenience this may cause you. If you have any questions or you have moved from the Winch Road area, then please call 105.

Our reference number for these works is: INCD-105459-C.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript:
This work is taking place in Winch Road. 

To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of our
equipment in your area. This has identified cables that need replacing and upgrading. Doing this
will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future.
To complete the work safely, we need to turn your power off to upgrade the cables. We will need
access to the inside of your property to conduct safety checks in the morning before we switch off
the power and we will need to do another check when we turn the power back on.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We regularly inspect our electrical equipment to ensure it is safe and efficient. We need to examine a transformer on our electricity poles to check it is functioning properly. This essential work helps to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power cuts in the future. To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your electricity. We are taking extra measures to limit the time your power is off and we'll do our best to cause as little disruption as possible. Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future. This work is taking place on The Common.

Our engineers need to temporarily switch off your power so we can safely cut the trees away from the cables. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate some customers may have experienced unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. This work is taking place near Church Road.
